abstract: Yahoo has amended its bylaws to give shareholders who want to nominate directors more time to do so, as it tries to buy time to explore alternatives to an unsolicited buyout offer from Microsoft.
snippet: Yahoo has amended its bylaws to give shareholders who want to nominate directors more time to do so, as it tries to buy time to explore alternatives to an unsolicited buyout offer from Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo has amended its bylaws to give shareholders who want to nominate directors more time to do so, as it tries to buy time to explore alternatives to an unsolicited buyout offer from Microsoft.

abstract: European regulators plan to approve Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion takeover of DoubleClick without conditions, rejecting complaints by Microsoft that the deal would hurt competition, according to Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: European regulators plan to approve Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion takeover of DoubleClick without conditions, rejecting complaints by Microsoft that the deal would hurt competition, according to Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Google’s DoubleClick Deal Said to Receive E.U. Approval

abstract: Microsoft has brought in some muscle to help it clinch a deal for Yahoo The software maker has enlisted Bear Stearns‘s chief, Alan D. Schwartz, to advise it on the $42 billion deal, according to The Wall Street Journal.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has brought in some muscle to help it clinch a deal for Yahoo The software maker has enlisted Bear Stearns‘s chief, Alan D. Schwartz, to advise it on the $42 billion deal, according to The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: Microsoft Said to Hire Bear C.E.O. as Adviser in Yahoo Pursuit

abstract: European regulators are preparing to approve Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick, according to wire reports. The delay was caused by complaints from Microsoft, which may not look so important now that the company is trying to buy Yahoo.
snippet: European regulators are preparing to approve Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick, according to wire reports. The delay was caused by complaints from Microsoft, which may not look so important now that the company is trying to buy Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Google’s year in the penalty box may be over.

headline.main: Will Europe Let Google Out of the Penalty Box?
